title: Goverment to probe 'tragedy' of Bury's expulsion from Football League in one-off evidence session
text:
The Government probe into the demise of Bury and the administration of football clubs will take place on 21 October.

The Department of Digital, Culture, Media and Sport invited written evidence ahead of the one-off evidence session, after describing Bury's expulsion as a 'tragedy'.

Attendees will be confirmed next week but it is likely there will be representation from the EFL, FA and Premier League.

Bury's expulsion from the Football League is to be probed by the government

After the decision to eject Bury from the Football League, the club appealed to clubs to allow them back into League Two.

The plea was rejected and after Steve Dale failed to clear their debts and players and staff went unpaid, the club were served a winding-up petition by HMRC before agreeing a company voluntary arrangement.
